name: AWS DynamoDB
description: This app supports CRUD operations in a AWS DynamoDB database

use_role.description: Use attached role when running Phantom in EC2

actions.description: Fetch metadata of a global table

backup_arn.description: Backup ARN of backup to describe

contains: aws dynamodb kms master key id

table_name.description: Name of the table to describe

actions.description: Create a global table from an existing table in the specified region
actions.verbose:
• Conditions to create a global table :

    • The table must have the same name as all of the other replicas
    • The table must have DynamoDB Streams enabled, with the stream containing both the new and the old images of the item.

  • If you want to add a new replica table to a global table, each of the following conditions must be true:

    • The table must have the same primary key as all of the other replicas.
    • The table must have the same name as all of the other replicas.
    • The table must have DynamoDB Streams enabled, with the stream containing both the new and the old images of the item.
    • None of the replica tables in the global table can contain any data.

  • If global secondary indexes are specified, then the following conditions must also be met:

    • The global secondary indexes must have the same name.
    • The global secondary indexes must have the same hash key and sort key (if present).

  • If local secondary indexes are specified, then the following conditions must also be met:

    • The local secondary indexes must have the same name.
    • The local secondary indexes must have the same hash key and sort key (if present).

global_table_name.description: Name of Table to make global

replication_group.description: Name of region to create global table

actions.description: Create a backup of an existing table

table_name.description: Name of the Table to backup

actions.description: Create a new table from an existing backup
actions.verbose:
NOTE

Restore Secondary Indexes parameter is used to restore the define the secondary indexes of the new restored table. There are following two options for the parameter:

  • Restore the entire table

    Restore table with original indexes as they are in the backup

  • Restore the table without secondary indexes (Selected by Default)

    Restore table without any indexes. There will be no Local and GLobal Secondary Index. Incase you want to add indexes, you can only create Global Secondary Indexes. Local Secondary Indexes cannot be created once the table is create.Hence there will be no Local Secondary Index is this option is selected.

table_name.description: Name of the table to restore

backup_arn.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with the backup

billing_mode_override.description: Billing mode of the restored table

read_capacity_override.description: Read capacity override (for PROVISIONED billing mode)

write_capacity_override.description: Write capacity override (for PROVISIONED billing mode)

restore_secondary_indexes.default: Restore the table without secondary indexes
value_list: Restore the table without secondary indexes

kms_master_key_id.description: Key to use for the AWS KMS encryption (Used when SSE is enabled)

actions.description: List all the tables present in the database

max_items.description: Maximum number of tables to fetch

exclusive_start_table_name.description: List table after specific given table name

actions.description: Delete a table from the database
Create a table in the database
actions.verbose:
• Each table has a Primary Key to identify items uniquely. The primary in DynamoDB is made up of Partition Key and Sort Key. Sort is Optional, but once the table is created you cannot add/update Sort Key

  • All the keys(partition & sort) in Dynamodb have only three supported datatype [String,Number,Binary]

  • The Billing mode defines how you going to be charged for read and write throughput and how you manage capacity.This setting can be changed later.

    Billing Mode has two values, by default it will be set to PROVISIONED.

    • PROVISIONED: Sets the billing mode to Provisioned Mode
    • PAY PER REQUEST: Sets the billing mode to On-Demand Mode

    When the billing mode is Provisioned, read and write capacity becomes required parameters. The values for read and write capacity units are default set to 5. Also, auto-scaling is disabled.

  • Secondary Indexes

    • For creating Local Secondary Index (LSI) and Global Secondary Index (GSI), please refer the documentation above.
    • Once created local secondary index cannot be added/updated, but Global Secondary can be created.

  • A DynamoDB stream is an ordered flow of information about changes to items in a DynamoDB table. When you enable a stream on a table, DynamoDB captures information about every modification to data items in the table. To enable streams for table, check the enable stream checkbox.

    If stream are enabled you need to select stream view type. There are four options you could select from:

    • KEYS ONLY: Only the key attributes of the modified item are written to the stream.
    • NEW IMAGE: The entire item, as it appears after it was modified, is written to the stream.
    • OLD IMAGE: The entire item, as it appeared before it was modified, is written to the stream.
    • NEW AND OLD IMAGES: Both the new and the old item images of the item are written to the stream.

  • SSE

    • Set it to true to use server-side encryption.
    • For the KMS master key id provide the KMS key value that should be used for encryption.

  • The KMS key that should be used for the KMS encryption. To specify a key, use its key ID, Amazon Resource Name (ARN), alias name, or alias ARN. Note that you should only provide this parameter if the key is different from the default DynamoDB key alias/aws/dynamodb

  • To learn the way of taking input for local and global secondary index, please refer the documentation provided above for Local and Global Secondary Index.
  • To add tags to you table, follow the step given below
    • For a single values for tags, pass a JSON object. The JSON object should contain the 'Key' and 'Value' keys. These two keys are required and without these adding tags won't be possible. 
       { 'Key' : 'key_data', 'Value' : 'value_data' }
    • For multiple values in tags, pass a list of JSON object. 
       [ { 'Key' : 'key_data1', 'Value' : 'value_data1' }, { 'Key' : 'key_data2', 'Value' : 'value_data2' } ]

table_name.description: Name of table to be created

billing_mode.description: Billing mode to be used for table

sort_key_name.description: Sort key name for table items

actions.description: Get an item from the table
actions.verbose: We don't need to pass value in encoded format for the parameters.

table_name.description: Name of table from which you want to fetch item

attributes_to_get.description: To fetch specific attributes from the item

reserved_keyword_attributes.description: To fetch attributes from items whose names are same as reserved keywords

actions.verbose:
• Select Parameter
    • The select parameter defines what attributes are supposed to fetched. There are following options :
      • ALL_ATTRIBUTES : Returns all of the item attributes from the specified table or index. If you query a local secondary index, then for each matching item in the index, DynamoDB fetches the entire item from the parent table. If the index is configured to project all item attributes, then all of the data can be obtained from the local secondary index, and no fetching is required.
      • ALL_PROJECTED_ATTRIBUTES : Allowed only when querying an index. Retrieves all attributes that have been projected into the index. If the index is configured to project all attributes, this return value is equivalent to specifying ALL_ATTRIBUTES
      • COUNT : Returns the number of matching items, rather than the matching items themselves
      • SPECIFIC_ATTRIBUTES : Returns only the attributes listed in ProjectionExpression. This return value is equivalent to specifying ProjectionExpression without specifying any value for Select
    • If you use the ProjectionExpression parameter, then the value for Select can only be SPECIFIC_ATTRIBUTES. Any other value for Select will return an error.
  • Return Consumed Capacity Parameter
    • Determines the level of detail about either provisioned or on-demand throughput consumption that is returned in the response. There are following options :
      • INDEXES - The response includes the aggregate ConsumedCapacity for the operation, together withConsumedCapacity for each table and secondary index that was accessed.
      • TOTAL - The response includes only the aggregate ConsumedCapacity for the operation.
      • NONE - No ConsumedCapacity details are included in the response.
  • KeyConditionExpression Parameter

table_name.description: Name of Table to perform query on

index_name.description: Name of index to be used for the query

filter_expression.description: Expression to filter data from table.A FilterExpression does not allow key attributes. You cannot define a filter expression based on a partition key or a sort key

projection_expression.description: Defines the attributes to be included in the result. If this expression is provided SELECT value is set to SPECIFIC_ATTRIBUTES. The attributes in the expression must be separated by commas

select.description: Retrieve all item attributes, specific item attributes, the count of matching items, or in the case of an index, some or all of the attributes projected into the index

return_consumed_capacity.description: Determines the level of detail about either provisioned or on-demand throughput consumption that is returned in the response

max_items.description: Maximum number of items to process

sort_descending.description: By default, the sort order for query data is ascending. To reverse the order, set the sort_descending parameter to true

consistent_read.description: Determines the read consistency model: If set to true, then the operation uses strongly consistent reads; otherwise, the operation uses eventually consistent reads

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using the supplied configuration
